newsitem.title: USA: Calif. university regents adopt budget proposal.
newsitem.headline: Calif. university regents adopt budget proposal.

text.p: The University of California Board of Regents on Friday adopted a proposed 1997-98 budget that calls for general purpose expenditures of $3 billion, an increase of 4.8 percent over this year.
The Regents took no action regarding student fees, deferring those considerations until January when Gov. Pete Wilson unveils his proposed state budget.
"The budget request is the minimum needed to maintain quality and ensure access," said Larry Hershman, University of California associate vice president and budget director.

Based on the governor's four-year compact with higher education, the university can expect at least a four-percent increase in state funding for next year for a total of $2.04 billion. That would be slightly less state funding than the University of California received in budget year 1989-1990.

The University of California budget for 1997-1998 anticipates a general student fee increase of slightly less than 10 percent unless extra state funding is available next year to "buy out" the fee hike, the Regents said.
